reviews.review_msg: He seems like a nice guy but not the best prof. I went to the first few lectures, but after being told numerous times that everything we need to know is in the textbook and he won't introduce any new information in lecture, I stopped attending. He basically discourages attendance. Exams were fair but papers are long. Tutorials weren't very helpful.

Lectures are mostly useless, he mostly draws exam questions from the textbook overall, tests and assignment (2 papers: research proposal) are easy marks Just remember to follow instructions in the papers, it will be an easy A.

Textbook is essential, due to useless lectures. Lectures are basically constructed of being told everything is in the text. Slides are changed before you can even read a word, thus taking notes is not even a possibility. Two papers, pretty long, but easy marks. Overall, tests and papers are not difficult. Lectures are definitely useless though.

His lectures start off as "everything is in the textbook so I'll just show exactly what you already read". Taking notes is completely pointless as he switches slides before you can even read the first line. He also doesn't help you at all and only sends you which textbook pages to read when you do need help. Worst class I've ever taken. STAY AWAY!
If you're planning to take notes off his lecture slides I hope you have photographic memory because he will change a slide with 50 words before you can even blink 2 times

He seems like a laid back guy. I had him for CRIM 220 and the class is supposed to be 1 hour and 50 minutes long, but his lecture would only last about a hour or less, so you'd always be out of class early. Just make sure to read the textbook for the exams as his slides are pretty useless.

Wasn't that bad. Weekly quiz and discussions which are easy marks. Assignments are two case studies on a serial killer which are actually fun to write. Not difficult if you put in the effort. Overall I found the course extremely disorganized though, but a good option if you need CRIM 103
I took this course via distance ed and it wasn't too bad. Read the textbook and you'll do fine. 2 papers for 50% of the grade, online quizzes every week and a lot of online discussions.

distance ed course. DO NOT TAKE. TM marked papers really difficult, and didn't respond to any questions I had. Terrible TM, and terrible prof (i tried to email him, also no response). Do not take this class via DE. take it at campus

I enrolled in the distance ed version of this "death by a thousand assignments" style course that included weekly quizzes and online group discussions. I never actually dealt w/ the prof, but the course itself required an unreasonable amount of commitment. I would spend more time on this course than my 2 lab courses combined. Would not recommend

Took by distance learning. A haphazard class with too much going on (weekly quiz, weekly forum participation etc). The marking was quite severe for the papers and you don't get to choose your topic, it is chosen for you and it's a pretty obscure figure. The book is very interesting but the final was full of odd questions. Hard to pin down.

worst dis. ed. course ever. do not take it, the essays are stupid and you're NOT told how exactly you are suppose to analyze the criminal. horrible TA, Courtenay. bad course in general and there is no instructions on how to best study for the final, it's "make your own notes", stupid rite? Hell yes! DO NOT take it, definitely a GPA PLUNGER! no joke
